displayName.text: Local 6 Hotel, Restaurant & Club Employees & Bartenders Union, UNITE-HERE

adrFormatAddress: 709 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: These new union officials are very corrupt that they vouched for management on anything agains union workers.  Personally, if you can get a buyout then take it.  I highly doubt it if any unions would be around after the contract ends on 2025.   Won‚Äôt say what hotel I left from, but if any hotel chain that deals with local 6 is very toxic.   Take the money and run, especially if you‚Äôre near retirement.

originalText.text: I‚Äôm Alexander Ruiz from the Time hotel üè® I have a recording between the business agent and the vice president talking about us union members and I‚Äôm a delegate saying we won‚Äôt getting anything I went today to fill out a complaint against my business agent and he was there but he don‚Äôt have time for me so he just sent another business agent to get my statement about my situation he‚Äôs corrupt and he‚Äôs working with management side to side mr Enrique Polanco take my statement and say he will send it to the president and vice president of the union but I feel betrayed because he doesn‚Äôt backed up the employees that are union members and pay union dues I have doubts about the report that I make will go forward to the president but like I said they are covering up all my issues with the business agent Anthony Wilson and I‚Äôm sure nothing is going to be notified to the higher level so they can take action I ask for a copy and was denied to me how can I know they going to do the right thing and take action on our favor injustice coverups and the business agent corrupted by management

originalText.text: They really are no better than management. They take your union dues and when you really need their help, they are no where to be found! Trying to call your business representation is like cat and mouse! I'm not exaggerating at all. Ask ANY union member who has tried reaching their business rep. All this time I thought if you are in the union, your working days will be smooth and no one will pick on you. No, management will still pick on you if they can.  And the time when you need union representation, they dodge you like the plague. You have to track them down. Calling them = they will never pick up and sometimes the receptionist won't answer the calls. You have to go to their office and cross your fingers and hope that the business agent is there. The management plays you, and the union plays you. Being a working class citizen and trying to make a decent living as a union member is overrated.
